org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.service

Class ForegroundService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.service.ForegroundService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FogGatewayService

    public abstract class ForegroundService
extends android.app.Service
    Service extension that automatically puts itself in the foreground at the start. This class also contains methods for simplifying the management of the service lifecycle.
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        protected abstract int execute()
        Custom operations to execute at service start-up. It is executed after initialization, when the service receives the ACTION_START action. For defining custom actions refer to customAction(String).
        Returns:
        KEEP_ALIVE or SHOULD_STOP.
        See Also:
        onStartCommand(Intent, int, int)

      • init

        protected boolean init(android.os.Bundle extras)
        Custom operations to execute at service initialization during start-up. This method should contain only the initialization and not hang up the service. For long executions, use execute().
        Parameters:
        extras - the extras in the Intent that triggered the service.
        Returns:
        true if everything is alright, false if the service should be aborted.

      • sendIntentToForegroundService

        public static void sendIntentToForegroundService(android.content.Context context,
                                                 java.lang.String action,
                                                 android.os.Bundle extras,
                                                 java.lang.Class<? extends ForegroundService> cls)
        Sends an Intent to the service.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context in which Context.startService(Intent) will be called.
        action - the action of the service (it can be one of ACTION_START or ACTION_STOP, or it could be a cutom action handled by customAction(String).
        extras - extras to be added to the Intent.
        cls - the class of the service to be started.
        See Also:
        #startForegroundService(Context, Class, Class), #startForegroundService(Context, Bundle, Class, Class), stopForegroundService(Context, Class)

      • startForegroundService

        public static void startForegroundService(android.content.Context context,
                                          android.os.Bundle extras,
                                          java.lang.Class<? extends ForegroundService> serviceClass)
        Starts the ForegroundService by sending the ACTION_START action.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context in which Context.startService(Intent) will be called.
        extras - extras to be added to the Intent.
        serviceClass - the class of the service to be started.
        See Also:
        sendIntentToForegroundService(Context, String, Bundle, Class), #startForegroundService(Context, Class, Class), stopForegroundService(Context, Class), bind(Context, ServiceConnection, Class)

        Parameters:

        serviceClass - the class of the service to be started.

      • stopForegroundService

        public static void stopForegroundService(android.content.Context context,
                                         java.lang.Class<? extends ForegroundService> cls)
        Stops the ForegroundService by sending the ACTION_STOP action.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context in which Context.stopService(Intent) will be called.
        cls - the class of the service to be started.
        See Also:
        sendIntentToForegroundService(Context, String, Bundle, Class), #startForegroundService(Context, Bundle, Class, Class), #startForegroundService(Context, Class, Class)

        public static void bind(android.content.Context context,
                        android.content.ServiceConnection connection,
                        java.lang.Class<? extends ForegroundService> cls)
        Binds the Context to the ForegroundService.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context in which Context.stopService(Intent) will be called.
        connection - the ServiceConnection callback to be used.
        cls - the class of the service to be started.

        Does something before the service stops itself using stopMe().

      • selfStartForeground

        protected boolean selfStartForeground(android.os.Bundle extras)
        Starts the service in the foreground.
        Parameters:
        extras - Intent extras passed to the service, used for customizing the notification in case a custom notification is used.
        Returns:
        true if everything was alright, false if the service should be aborted.
        See Also:
        makeNotification(Bundle)

      • makeNotification

        protected android.app.Notification makeNotification(android.os.Bundle extras)
        Builds the notification to be shown to the user. This creates the default notification unless overridden.
        Parameters:
        extras - extras passed to the service, used for customization of the notification.
        Returns:
        the built notification.

      • customAction

        protected boolean customAction(java.lang.String action)
        Handles a custom action. Override this method for defining a custom action.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be handled.
        Returns:
        true if action was handled, false otherwise.

      • onStartCommand

        public int onStartCommand(android.content.Intent intent,
                          int flags,
                          int startId)
        Based on the action in the Intent, it does one of the following:
        • ACTION_START: starts the service by calling init(Bundle) and selfStartForeground(Bundle) and finally execute()
        • ACTION_STOP: stops itself by calling stopMe()
        • otherwise calls customAction(String) which will handle the action
        Overrides:
        onStartCommand in class android.app.Service
        See Also:
        Service#onStartCommand(Intent, int, int)}

      • onBind

        public android.os.IBinder onBind(android.content.Intent intent)
        Return this binder.
        Specified by:
        onBind in class android.app.Service
